project.name: TaskGroup API
project.description: Technical API documentation for Bevry's TaskGroup flow control library.

BaseEventEmitter.name: BaseEventEmitter
BaseEventEmitter.description: Base class containing common functionality for {{#crossLink "Task"}}{{/crossLink}} and {{#crossLink "TaskGroup"}}{{/crossLink}}.

Task.name: Task
Task.description:
Our Task Class

Available configuration is documented in {{#crossLink "Task/setConfig"}}{{/crossLink}}.

Available events:

- `started()` - emitted when we start execution
- `running()` - emitted when the method starts execution
- `failed(error)` - emitted when execution exited with a failure
- `passed()` - emitted when execution exited with a success
- `completed(error, ...resultArguments)` - emitted when execution exited, `resultArguments` are the result arguments from the method
- `error(error)` - emtited if an unexpected error occurs without ourself
- `done(error, ...resultArguments)` - emitted when either execution completes (the `completed` event) or when an unexpected error occurs (the `error` event)

Available internal statuses:

- `null` - execution has not yet started
- `'started'` - execution has begun
- `'running'` - execution of our method has begun
- `'failed'` - execution of our method has failed
- `'passed'` - execution of our method has succeeded
- `'destroyed'` - we've been destroyed and can no longer execute

Example:

``` javascript
var Task = require('taskgroup').Task
var task

task = new Task('my synchronous task', function(){
	return 5
}).done(console.info).run()  // [null, 5]

task = new Task('my asynchronous task', function(complete){
	complete(null, 5)
}).done(console.info).run()  // [null, 5]

task = new Task('my task that returns an error', function(){
	var error = new Error('deliberate error')
	return error
}).done(console.info).run()  // [Error('deliberator error')]

task = new Task('my task that passes an error', function(complete){
	var error = new Error('deliberate error')
	complete(error)
}).done(console.info).run()  // [Error('deliberator error')]
```

TaskGroup.name: TaskGroup
TaskGroup.description:
Our TaskGroup class.

Available configuration is documented in {{#crossLink "TaskGroup/setConfig"}}{{/crossLink}}.

Available events:

- `started()` - emitted when we start execution
- `running()` - emitted when the first item starts execution
- `failed(error)` - emitted when execution exited with a failure
- `passed()` - emitted when execution exited with a success
- `completed(error, results)` - emitted when execution exited, `results` is an {Array} of the result arguments for each item that executed
- `error(error)` - emtited if an unexpected error occured within ourself
- `done(error, results)` - emitted when either the execution completes (the `completed` event) or when an unexpected error occurs (the `error` event)
- `item.*(...)` - bubbled events from an added item
- `task.*(...)` - bubbled events from an added {Task}
- `group.*(...)` - bubbled events from an added {TaskGroup}

Available internal statuses:

- `null` - execution has not yet started
- `'started'` - execution has begun
- `'running'` - execution of items has begun
- `'failed'` - execution has exited with failure status
- `'passed'` - execution has exited with success status
- `'destroyed'` - we've been destroyed and can no longer execute

classitems.description: A helper method to create a new subclass with our extensions.

params.name: extensions
params.description: - The methods and properties to use.

return.description: A new instance of the sub class.

classitems.name: subclass

classitems.description: Creates a new {SubClass} instance.

params.name: args
params.description: - The arguments to be forwarded along to the constructor.

classitems.name: create

classitems.description:
BaseEventEmitter Constructor

Adds support for the done event while
ensuring that errors are always handled correctly.
It does this by listening to the `error` and `completed` events,
and when the emit, we check if there is a `done` listener:

- if there is, then emit the done event with the original event arguments
- if there isn't, then output the error to stderr and throw it.

params.description: - Attaches to the `done` event.

classitems.name: whenDone

params.description: - Attaches to the `done` event.

params.name: listener
params.description: - Attaches to the `done` event.

classitems.description: Gets our name prepended by all of our parents names

classitems.name: names

classitems.description:
Get the name of our instance.
If the name was never configured, then return the name in the format of `'#{this.type} #{Math.random()}'` to output something like `task 0.2123`
classitems.name: name

classitems.description: Get extra state information for debugging.

classitems.description: Executes the passed function either synchronously if `config.sync` is `true` or delays it for the next tick.

params.description: - The function to execute

classitems.description:
The type of our class.

Used for the purpose of duck typing
which is needed when working with node virtual machines
as instanceof will not work in those environments.

classitems.name: isTask

classitems.description: Have we started execution yet?
classitems.name: started

classitems.description: Have we finished its execution yet?
classitems.name: exited

classitems.description: Have we been destroyed?
classitems.name: destroyed

classitems.description: Have we completed its execution yet?
classitems.name: completed

classitems.description: The first {Error} that has occured.
classitems.name: error

classitems.description: A {String} containing our current status. See our {Task} description for available values.
classitems.name: status

classitems.description: An {Array} of the events that we may emit. Events that will be executed can be found in the {Task} description.
classitems.name: events

classitems.description:
An {Array} representing the returned result or the passed {Arguments} of our method.
The first item in the array should be the {Error} if it exists.

classitems.description: The {Domain} that we create to capture errors for our method.
classitems.name: taskDomain

classitems.description: Initialize our new {Task} instance. Forwards arguments onto {{#crossLink "Task/setConfig"}}{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: constructor

classitems.description: Set the configuration for our instance.

props.name: name
props.description: - What we would like our name to be, useful for debugging.

props.name: done
props.description: - Passed to {{#crossLink "Task/onceDone"}}{{/crossLink}} (aliases are `onceDone`, and `next`)

props.name: whenDone
props.description: - Passed to {{#crossLink "Task/whenDone"}}{{/crossLink}}

props.name: on
props.description: - A map of event names linking to listener functions that we would like bounded via {EventEmitter.on}.

props.name: once
props.description: - A map of event names linking to listener functions that we would like bounded via {EventEmitter.once}.

props.name: parent
props.description: - A parent {{#crossLink "TaskGroup"}}{{/crossLink}} that we may be attached to.

props.name: onError
props.description: - Either `'exit'` or `'ignore'`, when `'ignore'` duplicate run errors are not reported, useful when combined with the timeout option.

props.name: sync
props.description: - Whether or not we should execute certain calls asynchronously (set to `false`) or synchronously (set to `true`).

props.name: method
props.description: - The {Function} to execute for our {Task}.

props.name: args
props.description: - Arguments that we would like to forward onto our method when we execute it.

props.name: timeout
props.description: - Millesconds that we would like to wait before timing out the method.

props.name: ambi
props.description: - Whether or not to use bevry/ambi to determine if the method is asynchronous or synchronous and execute it appropriately.

props.name: domain
props.description: - Whether or not to wrap the task execution in a domain to attempt to catch background errors (aka errors that are occuring in other ticks than the initial execution).

classitems.name: setConfig

classitems.description:
What to do when our task method completes.
Should only ever execute once, if it executes more than once, then we error.

params.name: args
params.description: - The arguments that will be applied to the {::result} variable. First argument is the {Error} if it exists.

classitems.name: exit

classitems.description: Set our task to the completed state.
classitems.name: finish

classitems.description: Allow the user to abort the execution of this task.

classitems.description:
An {Array} that contains the result property for each completed {Task} and {TaskGroup}.
An item can disable having its result property added to this results array by setting its {includeInResults} configuration option to `false`.
classitems.name: results

classitems.description: An {Array} of each {Task} and {TaskGroup} in this group that are still yet to execute.
classitems.name: itemsRemaining

todo: offer the ability to disable this completely via `storeRunningItems: false`
classitems.name: itemsRunning

classitems.description: An {Array} of each {Task} and {TaskGroup} in this group that have completed.
todo: offer the ability to disable this completely via `storeCompletedItems: false`

params.description: - The configuration to merge.

params.description: - The configuration to merge.

classitems.name: setNestedGroupConfig

classitems.description:
Set the configuration for our instance.

Despite accepting an {Object} of configuration, we can also accept an {Array} of configuration.	When using an array, a {String} becomes the :name, a {Function} becomes the :method, and an {Object} becomes the :config

props.name: name
props.description: - What we would like our name to be, useful for debugging.

props.name: done
props.description: - Passed to {{#crossLink "TaskGroup/onceDone"}}{{/crossLink}} (aliases are `onceDone`, and `next`)

props.name: whenDone
props.description: - Passed to {{#crossLink "TaskGroup/whenDone"}}{{/crossLink}}

props.name: on
props.description: - A map of event names linking to listener functions that we would like bounded via {EventEmitter.on}.

props.name: once
props.description: - A map of event names linking to listener functions that we would like bounded via {EventEmitter.once}.

props.name: parent
props.description: - A parent {{#crossLink "TaskGroup"}}{{/crossLink}} that we may be attached to.

props.name: onError
props.description: - Either `'exit'` or `'ignore'`, when `'ignore'` duplicate run errors are not reported, useful when combined with the timeout option.

props.name: sync
props.description: - Whether or not we should execute certain calls asynchronously (set to `false`) or synchronously (set to `true`).

props.name: method
props.description: - The {Function} to execute for our {TaskGroup} when using inline execution style.

props.name: run
props.description: - A {Boolean} for whether or not to the :method (if specified) automatically.

props.name: concurrency
props.description: - The amount of items that we would like to execute at the same time. Use `0` for unlimited. `1` accomplishes serial execution, everything else accomplishes parallel execution.

props.name: nestedGroupConfig
props.description: - The nested configuration to be applied to all {TaskGroup} descendants of this group.

props.name: nestedTaskConfig
props.description: - The nested configuration to be applied to all {Task} descendants of this group.

props.name: tasks
props.description: - An {Array} of {Task} instances to be added to this group.

props.name: groups
props.description: - An {Array} of {TaskGroup} instances to be added to this group.

props.name: items
props.description: - An {Array} of {Task} and/or {TaskGroup} instances to be added to this group.

classitems.name: setConfig

classitems.description: Prepare the method and it's configuration, and add it as a task to be executed.

params.name: method
params.description: - The function we want to execute as the method of this TaskGroup.

params.name: config
params.description: - Optional configuration for the task to be created for the method.

classitems.name: addMethod

classitems.description:
Autorun ourself under certain conditions.

Those conditions being:

- if we the :method configuration is defined, and we have no :parent
- if we the :run configuration is `true`

Used primarily to cause the :method to fire at the appropriate time when using inline style.

classitems.name: addGroupsChain

classitems.description: Gets the total number of items inside our task group.
classitems.name: totalItems

classitems.description:
Gets the total number count of each of our item lists.

Returns an {Object} containg the hashes:

- remaining - A {Number} of the names of the remaining items.
- running - A {Number} of the names of the running items.
- completed - A {Number} of the names of the completed items.
- total - A {Number} of the total items we have.
- results - A {Number} of the total results we have.
classitems.name: itemTotals

classitems.description:
Gets the names of the items, the total number of items, and their results for the purpose of debugging.

Returns an {Object} containg the hashes:

- remaining - An {Array} of the names of the remaining items
- running - An {Array} of the names of the running items
- completed - An {Array} of the names of the completed items
- total - A {Number} of the total items we have
- results - An {Array} of the results of the compelted items
classitems.name: itemNames

classitems.description: Whether or not we have any running items.
classitems.name: hasRunning

classitems.description: Whether or not we have any items yet to execute.
classitems.name: hasRunning

classitems.description: Whether or not we have any items running or remaining.
classitems.name: hasItems

classitems.description: Whether or not we have an error.
classitems.name: hasError

classitems.description: Whether or not we have an error or a result.
classitems.name: hasResult

classitems.description: Whether or not we have any available slots to execute more items.
classitems.name: hasResult

classitems.description:
Whether or not we are capable of firing more items.

This is determined whether or not we are not paused, and we have remaning items, and we have slots able to execute those remaning items.
classitems.name: shouldFire

classitems.description: Whether or not we have errord and want to pause when we have an error.
classitems.name: shouldPause

classitems.description: Whether or not we execution is currently paused.
classitems.name: paused

classitems.description: Whether or not we have no running or remaining items left.
classitems.name: empty

classitems.description: Whether or not we have finished execution.
classitems.name: exited

classitems.description: Whether or not we have started execution.
classitems.name: started

classitems.description:
Whether or not we execution has completed.

Completion of executed is determined of whether or not we have started, and whether or not we are currently paused or have no remaining and running items left

classitems.name: finish

classitems.description: We want to halt execution and trigger our completion callback.

figure out how this should actually work?
Should it be two methods? .halt() and .abort(error?)
Should it be a state?
Should it alter the state?
Should it clear or destroy?
What is the definition of pausing with this?
Perhaps we need to update the definition of pausing to be halted instead?
How can we apply this to Tasks instead?
